title: Arcade Fire White Label Leaks
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/05/arcadefire-suburbs-month-of-may.jpg "arcadefire-suburbs-month-of-may")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/05/arcadefire-suburbs-month-of-may.jpg)

As discovered earlier by P4K, a white label vinyl of the new Arcade Fire single was found by a Chris Ward in a Glasgow record store. As it turns out, a handful have managed to get in to the big wide world, one of which was found by Zane Lowe and promptly played on his Radio 1 show tonight, making this the one day his ‘hottest record in the world’ bullshit is actually true for once. Think about it, who **doesn’t** like Arcade Fire in the slightest? More importantly, if you know of someone, do they have a soul and are they sentient enough to be protected by human rights laws?

First, the important part, links:

**Download (slow, after all there are quite a lot of people wanting them. Not sure why)-**

A:[The Suburbs](http://onethirtybpm.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/05/Arcade-Fire-The-Suburbs.mp3)

B: [Month of May](http://onethirtybpm.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/05/Arcade-Fire-Month-of-May1.mp3)

**Listen-**

httpv://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mji0mxSXt8Q

A: The Suburbs

httpv://www.youtube.com/watch?v=23X24Ei7J2w

B: Month of May

Of the two, The Suburbs sounds more like a good album track (hopefully) than a lead single. Absoloutely nothing wrong with it at first listen, but perhaps a bit too plodding when it’s B Side is the tempo it is. Still, the track recalls the pre-Funeral work that made us all fall in love with the band the first time around, though it manages to do so without sounding like a backwards step.

Month of May, meanwhile, sees Arcade Fire revive their rockier side, all that talk by Win of his love for Bruce Springsteen clearly wasn’t a lie. Of the two, this is the winner for me (after two listens though). I would write more on this, but you’re listening to it right now. You are aren’t you?
